Write an equation to calculate the total cost of a product.
Price of the product = $24
Quantity = 3
Shipping cost = $8

To calculate the total cost of a product, you can use the following equation:

\[ \text{Total Cost} = (\text{Price of the Product} \times \text{Quantity}) + \text{Shipping Cost} \]

Given:
- Price of the product = $24
- Quantity = 3
- Shipping cost = $8

Plug these values into the equation:

\[ \text{Total Cost} = (24 \times 3) + 8 \]

\[ \text{Total Cost} = 72 + 8 \]

\[ \text{Total Cost} = 80 \]

So, the total cost of the product is $80.
